result.execSummary:
The defendant Earnest Hardy III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court ordered defendant to pay ALL COSTS and SURCHARGES by 11-13-2015 or, as a penalty if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.
with credit for 4 days served, FOR A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Earnest Hardy III

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Due to not following the payment plan agreement, specifically payment(s) were missed, the payment plan has been ended and the failure to pay action has been enforced.
Assessment for Attorney Fees in the amount of $252.00 entered as ordered by the court on 11/09/15 to pay $50.00 monthly.  Final payment due by 05/01/17. Failure to pay is a Civil Judgment.
Filed, signed Affidavit and Order for Payment of Attorney Fees and Costs.

Defendant Earnest Hardy in court with attorney Jane Heather Christopherson.  Defendant Earnest Hardy in custody.  Brittany Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  

Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Court sentenced defendant to serve 4 days in the House of Correction with credit for 4 days served FOR A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.  

Court ordered defendant to pay ALL COSTS and SURCHARGES by 11-13-2015 or, as a penalty if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Earnest Hardy not in court, defendant in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Attorney Jane Christopherson was in court earlier.  The defendant was not produced for today's appearance.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Jane Heather Christopherson in court, Defendant Earnest Hardy not in court, in custody.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant not produced from the House of Correction for purposes of this hearing. Awaiting discovery from previous attorney.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Attorney Lindo was in trial and unable to appear.  Case adjourned to August 7, 2015 at 8:30 am for pretrial conference in Branch 24.

Defendant Earnest Hardy not in court, defendant in custody.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  The defendant is now eligible for Public Defender representation.  The Public Defender's office has appointed Jane Christopherson on the felony and this case.  Attorney Christopherson was unaware she was appointed on this matter and did not appear on July 15, 2015.  Court ordered case adjourned for pretrial conference in Branch 24.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Earnest Hardy in court with attorney Laura Michelle Habush.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Case calendared for plea/sentencing hearing.  Defense tendered a guilty plea questionnaire to the Court.  Court began the guilty plea colloquy but declined to accept the defendant's plea at this time.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Earnest Hardy in court with attorney Laura Michelle Habush.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Case was calendared for a motion hearing in error.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Earnest Hardy in court with attorney Laura Michelle Habush.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense requests a motion date and will be filing 3 motions.  Defense to file motionm on/before February 25, 2015.  State response due on/before April 1, 2015.  Motion hearing scheduled for April 15, 2015 at 10:00 am.

ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.  The defendant has a pending case before Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.    Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  The defendant is not eligible for Public Defender representation.  The defendant requested the Court to appoint counsel.  Court questioned the defendant as to his income/monthly expenses.  Court will appoint counsel at the county's expense.  Court ordered the defendant to repay the county at the rate of $50.00 per month at the conclusion of the case.  Court appoints attorney Laura Habush to represent the defendant.  Court ordered case adjourned for pretrial conference in Branch 24.  Case rescheduled for pretrial conference on February 5, 2015 at 8:30 am.
No use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription  Status conference scheduled for 02-02-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Earnest Hardy in court.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible. The case is adjourned for a status Conference in Br.24.vb
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on ON 1/7/15 @ 1:30 pm
